intro: Conyza bracteolata, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, blue to purple in color, and arranged in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Conyza bracteolata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
